alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:17AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wood and northern Hancock Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 217 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Weston, or 10 miles west of Bowling Green, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Findlay, Bowling Green, North Baltimore, McComb, Weston, Arcadia, Van Buren, Grand Rapids, Bloomdale, Cygnet, Portage, Jerry City, Tontogany, Hoytville, Custar, Milton Center and Bairdstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT for northwestern Ohio.
